definition: The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
example: The discovery of penicillin was a perfect example of serendipity.
Examples_in_English: Their meeting at the coffee shop was pure serendipity.
Examples_in_Yoruba: Ipade wọn ni ile ọti kọfí jẹ́ aṣedeede.
Cultural_Note: The concept of fortunate accidents is appreciated across cultures.

definition: Lasting for a very short time.
example: The ephemeral beauty of sunset only lasted a few minutes.
Examples_in_English: Social media fame is often ephemeral.
Examples_in_Yoruba: Òkìkí lórí àwọn mídiá tó wà fún ìbágbépọ̀ jẹ́ aifọjọpẹ púpọ̀.
Cultural_Note: Traditional Yoruba philosophy recognizes the temporary nature of physical existence.

example: Mobile phones have become ubiquitous in modern society.
Examples_in_English: Plastic waste has become ubiquitous in our oceans.
Examples_in_Yoruba: Idọti pílásítíìkì ti di gbogbogbòò nínú òkun wa.
Cultural_Note: The concept relates to the Yoruba understanding of spiritual presence throughout the natural world.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
example: She gave an eloquent speech at the graduation ceremony.
Examples_in_English: His eloquent argument convinced even his strongest critics.
Examples_in_Yoruba: Àgúmẹ́ntì rẹ̀ tí ó pòjúpọ̀ gba àwọn alatakò rẹ̀ lọ́kàn.
Cultural_Note: Oratory skills are highly valued in Yoruba culture, especially for leaders and elders.

definition: The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
example: The resilience of the community in rebuilding after the disaster was remarkable.
Examples_in_English: Her resilience in the face of adversity inspired everyone around her.
Examples_in_Yoruba: Ìfarada rẹ̀ nígbà ìnira gbé ọkàn àwọn tó wà ní àyíká rẹ̀ sókè.
Cultural_Note: Resilience is a deeply embedded value in Yoruba culture, reflected in proverbs about perseverance.

definition: A deep feeling of affection or care
caption: A symbol of affection

Proverbs_or_Idioms: Bí ilé bá ti dára, inú á dùn.
Common_Phrases: Ẹlẹ́ẹkan ni ilé ni mo fẹ.
caption: A traditional Yoruba hut

definition: Move at a speed faster than a walk
Proverbs_or_Idioms: Àṣeyọrí máa ń bẹ lẹ́yìn sáré.
Cultural_Note: Frequently used in proverbs related to effort
caption: A person running
